intro: Boerhavia litoralis, commonly known as sea blite, is a flowering plant native to coastal regions of the Mediterranean and parts of Africa. It is an annual herb that typically grows in sandy or saline soils, adapting well to harsh coastal environments. The plant features small, white or pale pink flowers that bloom in clusters, often along the stems. Its leaves are succulent and fleshy, which helps it retain water in arid conditions. Boerhavia litoralis is also known for its salt tolerance, making it a hardy species in coastal ecosystems.
